trans-unit.source: KMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects
trans-unit.target: KMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects

trans-unit.source: Sets the properties for the KMDF Verifier (or framework verifier) on a remote computer.
trans-unit.target: Sets the properties for the KMDF Verifier (or framework verifier) on a remote computer.

trans-unit.source: You can use these settings when you build and deploy a KMDF driver to a test computer.
trans-unit.target: You can use these settings when you build and deploy a KMDF driver to a test computer.

trans-unit.source: For information about KMDF drivers, see [Kernel-Mode Driver Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff557565).
trans-unit.target: For information about KMDF drivers, see [Kernel-Mode Driver Framework](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff557565).

trans-unit.source: For more information about the framework verifier, see [Using the Framework's Verifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff545540) and [WDF Verifier Control Application](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff556129).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the framework verifier, see [Using the Framework's Verifier](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff545540) and [WDF Verifier Control Application](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/Library/Windows/Hardware/Ff556129).

trans-unit.source: Setting KMDF Verifier properties for driver package projects
trans-unit.target: Setting KMDF Verifier properties for driver package projects

trans-unit.source: Open the property pages for your driver package.
trans-unit.target: Open the property pages for your driver package.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: In the property pages for the driver package, click **Configuration Properties**, click **Driver Install**, and then click **KMDF Verifier**.
trans-unit.target: In the property pages for the driver package, click **Configuration Properties**, click **Driver Install**, and then click **KMDF Verifier**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Enable KMDF Verifier** option and select **KMDF verifier is always on**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Enable KMDF Verifier** option and select **KMDF verifier is always on**.

trans-unit.source: When this option is selected, you can configure the framework verification options for KMDF drivers.
trans-unit.target: When this option is selected, you can configure the framework verification options for KMDF drivers.

trans-unit.source: Option
trans-unit.target: Option

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Enable KMDF Verifier
trans-unit.target: Enable KMDF Verifier

trans-unit.source: Enables the KMDF verifier on the test computer.
trans-unit.target: Enables the KMDF verifier on the test computer.

trans-unit.source: The choices are KMDF verifier is always on or KMDF verifer is off.
trans-unit.target: The choices are KMDF verifier is always on or KMDF verifer is off.

trans-unit.source: If the KMDF verifier is not enabled, basic framework verification is enabled as part of Driver Verifier if KMDF version is 1.9 or higher.
trans-unit.target: If the KMDF verifier is not enabled, basic framework verification is enabled as part of Driver Verifier if KMDF version is 1.9 or higher.

trans-unit.source: KMDF Service Names
trans-unit.target: KMDF Service Names

trans-unit.source: Specifies the service names of the KDMF drivers to monitor.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the service names of the KDMF drivers to monitor.

trans-unit.source: IRQL checks
trans-unit.target: IRQL checks

trans-unit.source: Enables IRQL checks and critical memory leak checks.
trans-unit.target: Enables IRQL checks and critical memory leak checks.

trans-unit.source: Forward Compatible Checks
trans-unit.target: Forward Compatible Checks

trans-unit.source: Enables checks created after the current driver version.
trans-unit.target: Enables checks created after the current driver version.

trans-unit.source: Forward Progress Handler Testing
trans-unit.target: Forward Progress Handler Testing

trans-unit.source: Specifies options for testing forward progress handling of your driver.
trans-unit.target: Specifies options for testing forward progress handling of your driver.

trans-unit.source: No Allocation Failures No faults will be simulated to test the forward progress handling of your driver.
trans-unit.target: No Allocation Failures No faults will be simulated to test the forward progress handling of your driver.

trans-unit.source: Fail All Allocations All I/O requests destined for a forward progress queue will appear to fail, relying on your driver's forward progress handling.
trans-unit.target: Fail All Allocations All I/O requests destined for a forward progress queue will appear to fail, relying on your driver's forward progress handling.

trans-unit.source: Randomly Fail Allocations Randomly fail I/O requests destined for a forward progress queue.
trans-unit.target: Randomly Fail Allocations Randomly fail I/O requests destined for a forward progress queue.

trans-unit.source: Track KMDF Object Handles
trans-unit.target: Track KMDF Object Handles

trans-unit.source: Specifies the list of object handle types to track.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the list of object handle types to track.

trans-unit.source: Enable KMDF Loader Messages
trans-unit.target: Enable KMDF Loader Messages

trans-unit.source: Enables KMDF loader messages through the debugger.
trans-unit.target: Enables KMDF loader messages through the debugger.

trans-unit.source: A reboot of the target computer is required to enable this.
trans-unit.target: A reboot of the target computer is required to enable this.

trans-unit.source: Starting with Windows Vista, the operating system suppresses DbgPrint output by default, which makes the WDF Loader diagnostic messages unusable until the suppression is overridden.
trans-unit.target: Starting with Windows Vista, the operating system suppresses DbgPrint output by default, which makes the WDF Loader diagnostic messages unusable until the suppression is overridden.

trans-unit.source: KDMF Verifier can manage this for you so that KMDF loader diagnostics are available in the kernel debugger for these systems.
trans-unit.target: KDMF Verifier can manage this for you so that KMDF loader diagnostics are available in the kernel debugger for these systems.

trans-unit.source: Verbose logging
trans-unit.target: Verbose logging

trans-unit.source: Enables verbose logging.
trans-unit.target: Enables verbose logging.

trans-unit.source: Memory Pages for Logs
trans-unit.target: Memory Pages for Logs

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of non-paged pool pages (1-10) to allocate for kernel event trace logs.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of non-paged pool pages (1-10) to allocate for kernel event trace logs.

trans-unit.source: The options are Runtime Choice or [1-10].
trans-unit.target: The options are Runtime Choice or [1-10].

trans-unit.source: If Runtime Choice, the number of pages depends on the KMDF runtime.
trans-unit.target: If Runtime Choice, the number of pages depends on the KMDF runtime.

trans-unit.source: Starting with KMDF 1.9, the runtime uses more pages when verification is enabled with verbose logging.
trans-unit.target: Starting with KMDF 1.9, the runtime uses more pages when verification is enabled with verbose logging.

trans-unit.source: Fail Memory Allocations
trans-unit.target: Fail Memory Allocations

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of successful memory allocations allowed before the KMDF verifier starts to fail all memory allocations.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the number of successful memory allocations allowed before the KMDF verifier starts to fail all memory allocations.

trans-unit.source: Related topics
trans-unit.target: Related topics

trans-unit.target: Kernel-Mode Driver Framework

trans-unit.target: Driver Verifier

trans-unit.target: Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer
